name: Malayan Tapir
description: The Malayan Tapir is a large herbivore with a distinctive black-and-white coat.
spread_note: Found in Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia.
food_note: Forages at night in dense forests.
proportions: Length: 1.8-2.5 m, height: 90-110 cm, weight: 250-400 kg.
reproduction: Gestation about 13 months, one calf born.
attractions: Popular in zoos for their unique appearance.
projects_note: Endangered due to deforestation; conservation programs are active.
